page.title: 03TONMAWR TODAY - GENERAL
page.content: The Pelenna Valley is steep sided, with the{Pelenna River}running north-east to south-west. The Eastern side of the valley is covered in conifer forests,but to the West is high sheep pasture. The valley is a culdesac, as far as road traffic is concerned and so gets few casual visitors passing through.Two communities, Danycoed and Tonmawr itself, are in the valley, but only the latter is in the Domesday block. There are many signs of Tonmawr's industrial past - the embankment on which the railway ran, quarries from which building stone was taken, and the blocked up entrances to numerous derelict drift mines but the spoil tips associated with mining have gone. The general impression is rural and beautiful.
